comments.body:
I like this idea :)

Perhaps expand it by having other adult villagers dislikning the nitwit playing with baby villagers and shoo it away when they see this behaviour.
This is too cute! It also would give the nitwit a purpose.
I don't think that really fits the Nether, or has a use.
yeah I was just thinking that with all of the hostile mobs in the nether that a passive mob that you could tame would be cool.

Wouldn‚Äôt really make sense though, like I hate to take a dark turn but how would that thing survive in a place like the nether? It‚Äôs like putting a rabbit into hell and expecting it to thrive, a shroomite would most likely get eaten and wouldn‚Äôt make much sense, like every mob you see in the nether has some sort of defense that would help them survive like piglins have large groups and weapons and striders can flee onto lava, a shroomite being in the nether wouldn‚Äôt make sense
Maybe they scare away ghasts to give them some use
That's a nice idea, maybe the shoormite's defence sistem is their hability to hide so if they still hiding in the floor they can survive.
Sound's like a nice idea - maybe the duration increases as you kill villagers?
Good idea! Bc wandering traders have a better chance to spawn each day, this would greatly nerf leash farming.
This is possibly a bug but I agree that any zombie mob should have their hands out. Also should baby zombified piglins have sword if baby piglins cant??
The Kitsunes should have nine tails and only attack if provoked. They should ether have fire powers or electricity powers.
They they should also be very mischievous and can create illusions. I think they should also spawn in the Nether.

They could transform into Steve/Alex(random chance) when a player is nearby, and a villager if villagers are nearby. They could also transform into pillagers and other mobs. It would be an interesting mechanic in the game. There should also be a festival mask item that makes kitsune neutral and they would have unique trades. (ie. cherry tree saplings) They would spawn in taigas, snowy taigas and giant tree taigas, but they would only spawn near structures and player-made structures (this could be achieved by checking for cobblestone, stripped wood, and other such artificial blocks)

I'd say It'd work If spawned naturally In the soulsand valley and Invaded villages as normal foxes In the overworld and as a harbinger of ruin toward piglins and traveling players in the nether.

The kitsune should have 25 HP and 5 armor points, perhaps from the fact quartz Is embedded In It's clothing and mask. Their true form should normally resemble humanoids, with big floppy ears on top of their heads, big beady eyes that are out-right adorable, and fluffy tails that wiggle areound as they walk. (which unfortunately can't be pet).

They attack by summoning kitsunebi around them before firing the ring of fire one by one at you, simply using a sword, creating apparitions of other hostile mobs that die off upon being hit, (but drop nothing.) or turning Invisible to create duplicates so they can slice their victim with a sword. (sounds slightly familiar, huh?)

If they are to be slain, they should drop 0-4 bamboo, 1-3 blaze powder, and rarely their Iron sword (may be enchanted) Or their mask. (Known as an "Ancient mask", which can provide either strength, slow-fall, regeneration, jump boost, speed or haste while being worn. What effect It gives Is randomized between those 6, and the effect Is given In only lvl 1 form, not 2 or 3.)

If I could pair this trickster with anything, It'd be these: https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360067668172-Nekos-The-Iillagers-of-the-nether-and-their-camps

maybe the beter the reasource the beter the army 

charcaol: small zombie army

coal:zombies and skeletens 

quarts:2 pillagers and 2 vindicater zombies and skeletens 

iron: small force of every hostile mob

dimond: big force of every hostile mob

you may copy and past this if you want to add it you have my permission. p.s I spent 20 minutes making this.
this should be a thing
Super Scary idea! I love it!

UPDATED DENS

Dens will be underground but close enough to hear. The mobs will still have their normal functionalities but as far as the dens go, they'll be right underneath the player's feet. This'll make the Lurkers wander further out in more open areas while the player can continue their quest.

When captured by a Lurker, the Lurker may have to break a block or two to get in but once you‚Äôre inside, there‚Äôs no way out. You‚Äôll only be captured if you‚Äôre low on health.

 If killed, your items will be hidden within a type of soulsand called "Soulified Sand" where different items including your own may be hidden. Just place the sand and break it to see what it drops. Because they're hidden and have different drops, the soulified sand won't stack. This new type of soulsand will be found in a chest within the dens along with bones, gunpowder, and other soulified sand with other items from ‚Äúpast‚Äù explorers.
Why transform in Soul Sand, I think it would be more epic, if the "Withering" would transform the player in another Withering instead of soulsand.
Love the idea a shame it wasn't added to the Nether Update, but maybe like a mini update?

Great idea but what if the withering captures the players soul. This will cause them to be teleported to a new dimension known as the bog of lost souls. Thieves place is mostly made up of ruins of a fallen civilization made out of blackstone with occasional soul fire. Here the player will also find lost souls which are mobs the player has killed with a blue tint. Every mob is passive until the player looks at them. This will cause them to turn dark Antron where they‚Äôll attack the player. In order for the player to escape they have to find a wither kill it get its soul star, and drop it into soul fire.

Is pretty nice i'll add something more:

- A Third move can be a charge wich the iron golem do when he need to get closer to a mob or hit all the mobs on a path, this move will have a range of 6 blocks doing a high quantity of damage, if a mob get hit on the 6th block directly it will recieve a knockback of 5.
This also is a dangerous move because if the golem hits a wall while charging it will suffer damage not much and can break a distance x1 long of :wood, cobblestone, stone type block only and x3 long of dirt , sand only and a distance 2x long for all the sandstone variants.

Now on your first suggestion the damage can vary on the type of block.
Apoyo tu idea bro

Apoyo tu idea hermano aunque dudo que le den generos a los aldeanos, ya quisieron ponerles generos a los zancadores y decidiero que no porque serie mucho trabajo porque tambien tendrian que darle genero a mas mobs o sino que los jugadores se veerian confundidos
Maybe they should try to keep enemies within 5-8 blocks of them to stay out of melee range but still be able to fire.
it makes sense to make Pillagers smart and not shoot there fellow Raiders on hardcore.

I think it would be better to fight while maintaining a certain distance.Alternatively, double the damage taken from the Pillager's arrows so that the Illager can penetrate the Pillager's arrows without taking damage.Doubling the damage also solves the problem that Pillager is much weaker than Vindicator and Evoker.
I really like that, I've seen them do pretty stupid things too. once there was a raid and the pillagers saw a villager on the other side of a near-by ravine and they just pushed each other off.ü§£

Removed excess formatting.

Thanks for your contribution.
But they should only spawn in huts or weird houses at the end of the village.
I agree, they're not really traders unless they buy things too. Plus the things they normally sell are completely useless. They're basically just really annoying sources of free leads at this point.

I think it mostly makes sense that the Wandering Trader's stock is stuff he gathered himself wandering the world, so he wouldn't be willing to buy anything he can find himself, like plants. BUT you can't imagine him mining into deep and dangerous caves, or going to the End or the Nether, so perhaps he could have a chance of being willing to buy these rarer resources from the player. If he was only willing to buy non-renewable resources, that would keep him from becoming an infinite emerald generator you can just sell farmed items, but still allow players who don't like to go to villages or build their base in remote areas to trade with him.

Example of non-renewable items he could buy with emeralds are sponges or calcite, or the new amethyst shards (they are renewable but not easily farmable). Or he could offer a diamond-to-emerald exchange.

Moved to proper category.

Thanks for your contribution.

Like this. Something definitely has to change about how pillager patrols spawn. Nowadays when finding a village early game it's pretty much guaranteed for me that it'll be wiped out. This might prevent that because unless they killed all fifteen villlagers (could/would they?) then they wouldn't be attacking again until the numbers return.
Agreed. That way anyone can maintain their villager count under 15 until their base is well built enough for pillagers
Moved to correct category.
It would also be cool if it to a pillager out post it would become a pillager.
This could get weird.  What if I were to remove the door of a villager‚Äôs house?  What about harvesting all the crops from a villager‚Äôs farm before the villager could harvest any?
Werd ida
Which language?
Bilbo Baggins i‚Äôm guessing that you would be able to change the language in settings.
It would be hard to make the villagers talk.  That doesn‚Äôt matter to me, though.

"Not my squidwards!"

"HMMrmmmmm..."

Though as an in game toggle-able option its a cool and possibly useful concept. If you edit it to be optional (on/off) then I will vote.
Nope Villagers don‚Äôt need speech

I think that they could do things like, when it rains they run home saying things like "Aah!" "It's raining!" "Get inside!" and when they see a zombie they could run from it saying things like "Eek, zombie!" "ZOMBIE!" "Run awaaaaay!" and they could also talk to you like greeting you when they see you and after trading they thank you, and you could talk with them, such as when you hit them they would say "Ouch!" and then angrily ask why you hit them, and you could respond with things like "I'm sorry, it was an accident" "Because you're ugly" "I want you to get out of this building" and you could also do things like kindly ask them to please leave your house or yell at them to get out and then they would attempt to leave the building. They could talk in word bubbles.
the language thats turned on in the settings the one they will talk
Please for the love of God do not nerf the villagers!
But copper is too easy to accumulate. With fortune 3 I think we get up to 30 copper as of 1.18.The cartographer has an already very op trade with the glass pane.
i think vexes should try to mug allays
More features such as...
I love the arch illager character in Minecraft dungeons I hope they bring more dungeons content over and it could give us more boss battles
What kind of features do you suggest mojang should bring to the game involving illagers? Besides something from dungeons.
Is a good idea
Add SO MUCH more flavor to the minecraft world!

I know! along with this, I would love to see the villagers fight back, or have bigger villages with walls.

because it's kind of unfair that the villagers can't defend themselves when there are many mobs out there!
Yes I go with u.
Call it an Escutager.
Maybe once he is low health he starts using a shield and he tries to get close to you and take all the damage by acting as a human shield for evokers? Maybe name him "Racketeer"?
Maybe it could be like an elite member of the Pillagers that would show up as guards of Pillager outposts. Still a pretty good idea, I'm just adding on.
I was very upset at this change. There's no use for eggs anymore.
1.17 did give a new use to rabbit leather. Maybe we'll finally get scrambled eggs as well?
This feedback needs to be merged with others suggesting the same thing.
good idea!
They could have copper golems to defend them in the same way villages have iron golems. Copper golems could be powered by amethyst and shoot bolts of electricity that damage and stun mobs.
